addressleaf.section:
To
e honorable S
r
Robert Sidney knight Lord Gouvernor of
e towne of Flushing

page.lettertext:
fol.288r
S
r
Tho Bodley to S
r
Robert Sydney
By yo
r
L. letter by this bearer, and by an
other before, w
ch
was sent me from
Flushing,
I see yo
w
have no care, howe farre yo
w
putte me
in yo
r
debt, before yo
w
knowe in w
at
sort I am
able to discharge it. But I finde methinkes
againe,
at my affection is as muche, as yo
w
desire for repaiment, till yo
r
turne may be
served w
t
some better requital. And if
at
be yo
r
meaning, yo
w
shall see I will able
to crosse out yo
r
booke. It does trouble
me greatly, and is exceedingly prejudicial to my
privat estat,
at not onely I c
a
not gette
fr
o
this place, but
at I c
a
not come to knowledge
whereto I may trust: for w
ch
no order can
be taken, in much of my busines. I doe see
in
e end I must addresse my petiti
o
to
her
Ma
ties
handes, and put it in adventure
howe other men will like it. As in
e meane
seas
o
I am to thank yo
r
L. infinitly, for yo
r
loving remembrance in inquiring about me.
The affaires of this c
o
trey doe stand I knowe
not howe. For they are half in a manere
w
at
to do this
Co
u
cel,
some inclining to doe
like, and some to make a levie, as I write
yo
w
in my last. But I thinke in c
o
clu-
sio, they will falle to doe litle. For it will
be this moneth, before
e Provinces will meete
to showe w
at
line they will c
o
tribut, to
e
making of a levie.
Count holmes
is heere
to gette some soldieres ou t of
Holland,
for an
incursi
o
into
Flanders,
whereas I thinke he
will withold assent. It is also
posed
and like to take place,
at there may be a succo
r
of ten thousand pound sterling yelded to the
Frenche king
for
e levie of 2000 men for certaine moneths. Other mater heere is none
at is worth
e writing, and I will not take all fr
o
this bearers relati
o
: but still I rec
o
mend my last
suite to yo
r
L. as I may yo
w
unto me rec
o
mend w
at
yo
w
please where my service may ad-
vance any business of yo
wrs
.
Fr
o
e Hage 22 J
a
1592
Yo
r
L. most ready at c
o
maundement, Tho. Bodley.
